text: is a prefecture in the Chūbu region of Japan on the island of Honshū.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Fukui-ken" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 217; "Chūbu" at p. 126. The capital is the city of Fukui.Nussbaum, "Fukui" at p. 217. == History == In the early Meiji period, Fukui was created by the merger of Wakasa Province and Echizen Province.Nussbaum, "Provinces and prefectures" at p. 780. == Geography == The prefecture faces the Sea of Japan. It shares a northern border with Ishikawa Prefecture. East of Fukui are Gifu Prefecture and Shiga Prefecture. Kifu's southern border meets Kyoto Prefecture. ===Cities=== Fukui Prefecture includes the following cities: *Awara *Echizen *Fukui (capital city) *Katsuyama *Obama *Ōno *Sabae *Sakai *Tsuruga ===National Parks=== National Parks are established in about 15% of the total land area of the prefecture.Japan Ministry of the Environment, "General overview of area figures for Natural Parks by prefecture"; retrieved 2012-3-13. ==Shrines and Temples== Wakashiko jinja and Kehi jinja are the chief Shinto shrines (ichinomiya) in the prefecture."Nationwide List of Ichinomiya," p. 2 ; retrieved 2012-3-13. ==Related pages== * Provinces of Japan * Prefectures of Japan * List of regions of Japan * List of islands of Japan * Fukui Prefectural Dinosaur Museum ==References== == Other websites == * Fukui Prefecture website
title: Fukui Prefecture
